page.title: 11HYLTON CASTLE
page.content: Hylton Castle stands majesticlly in its own grounds beside the junction of the Craigavon and Washington roads. It is in the care of the Historic Buildings and Monuments Commission. It was built by Sir William Hylton about the year 1400 and is shaped like an enormous gatehouse. It was much altered in the 1860's and transformed into a suburban villa. However these parts have been removed and only the gatehouse and ruined chapel remain. Many parties of schoolchildren visit the castle which is open to the public all year round. Admission for schoolchildren is free. Visitors come from all over the world, notably America when those who have the surname Hylton may trace their ancestory. Souvenirs are on sale. A custodian is employed to help visitors
